# Arpeggio: add2 in D# (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is the addition of the 2nd note in the D# major scale to the D major arpeggio. It adds a unique flavor to the standard D major arpeggio and can be used to create interesting harmonic movements and melodic patterns.

## Notes and Intervals
- D# (Root)
- F# (Major 3rd)
- A# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (Add2, enharmonic to F, Major 9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is often used in genres such as jazz, fusion, and progressive rock. It adds a sense of tension and sophistication to the music, creating a rich and colorful sound. The add2 interval provides a sense of unpredictability and complexity to the harmonic structure, making it a versatile tool for creating dynamic and expressive musical compositions.
